item.title: AWS CloudShell
item.description: AWS CloudShell is a browser-based shell that makes it easy to securely manage, explore, and interact with your AWS resources. CloudShell is pre-authenticated with your console credentials. Common development and operations tools are pre-installed, so no local installation or configuration is required. With CloudShell, you can quickly run scripts with the AWS Command Line Interface (AWS CLI), experiment with AWS service APIs using the AWS SDKs, or use a range of other tools to be productive.

item.title: Configure your credentials
item.description: To configure your credentials, run below command aws configure Type your credentials and type us-east-1 in terms of region name AWS Access Key ID [None]: <type your access key id> AWS Secret Access Key [None]: <type your secret access key> Default region name [None]: us-east-1 Default output format [None]: If you forget the credentials, you need to create a new one in IAM console
